slides.title: Cost of Capital
slides.content:
# Cost of Capital

## Cost of Debt

```
Kd = Interest Rate x (1 - Tax Rate)

After-tax cost of debt
```

## Cost of Equity - CAPM

```
Ke = Rf + beta(Rm - Rf)

Rf = Risk-free rate
beta = Systematic risk
Rm = Market return
```

## WACC

```
WACC = (E/V x Ke) + (D/V x Kd)

E = Equity value
D = Debt value
V = Total value (E + D)
```

slides.title: Capital Structure Theory
slides.content:
# Optimal Capital Structure

## Modigliani-Miller

| Without Tax | With Tax |
|-------------|----------|
| Structure irrelevant | Debt adds value |
| No tax shield | Tax shield |

## Trade-Off Theory

```
Benefit of debt: Tax shield
Cost of debt: Financial distress

Optimal: Balance both
```

## Pecking Order

```
1. Internal funds (first choice)
2. Debt
3. Equity (last choice)
```

slides.title: Financial Leverage
slides.content:
# Leverage Effects

## Degree of Financial Leverage

```
DFL = EBIT / (EBIT - Interest)

or

DFL = % Change in EPS / % Change in EBIT
```

## Combined Leverage

```
DCL = DOL x DFL

Total risk amplification
```

## Leverage Impact

| High Leverage | Low Leverage |
|---------------|-------------|
| Amplifies returns | Stable returns |
| Higher risk | Lower risk |
| Fixed obligations | Flexibility |

slides.title: Working Capital Management
slides.content:
# Working Capital

## Definition

```
Working Capital = Current Assets - Current Liabilities
```

## Cash Conversion Cycle

```
Days Inventory
+ Days Receivables
- Days Payables
= Cash Conversion Cycle
```

## Policies

| Policy | Risk | Return |
|--------|------|--------|
| Aggressive | Higher | Higher |
| Conservative | Lower | Lower |
| Moderate | Medium | Medium |

## Financing Strategy

- Permanent: Long-term
- Temporary: Short-term

slides.title: Cash Management
slides.content:
# Cash and Liquidity

## Reasons to Hold Cash

| Motive | Purpose |
|--------|--------|
| Transaction | Daily operations |
| Precautionary | Unexpected needs |
| Speculative | Opportunities |

## Cash Models

### Baumol Model

```
Optimal Cash = sqrt(2 x T x F / r)

T = Cash needed
F = Fixed transaction cost
r = Interest rate
```

## Cash Flow Acceleration

- Lockbox systems
- Electronic transfers
- Concentration banking
